name: Romance
description: Focuses on relationships and romantic love, with sub-genres like contemporary, historical, suspense, and paranormal romance.

name: Crime/Mystery
description: Involves the investigation of a crime, with a detective or amateur sleuth working to solve a mystery by the story's end.

name: Thriller/Suspense
description: Designed to keep readers on edge with high levels of suspense and tension, often featuring espionage, legal issues, or psychological twists.

name: Fantasy
description: Includes magic or supernatural elements, with sub-genres such as epic fantasy, urban fantasy, and magical realism.

name: Science Fiction
description: Explores futuristic concepts, advanced technology, space exploration, time travel, and extraterrestrial life, focusing on their impact on society.

name: Young Adult
description: Features teenage protagonists dealing with a variety of themes, crossing genres such as romance, dystopia, and fantasy.

name: Historical Fiction
description: Set in the past, often during significant events, aiming to transport readers to another time and place with attention to historical detail.

name: Horror
description: Intended to frighten and unsettle, may include supernatural elements, psychological thrillers, and dark themes to induce fear.

name: Non-Fiction
description: Encompasses real-life subjects, including sub-categories like biographies, memoirs, self-help, and history, aiming to inform or educate readers.

name: Biography/Autobiography
description: Narrative of a person's life, told by someone else or by the individual themselves, often highlighting notable events and achievements.

name: Self-Help/Personal Development
description: Offers advice and strategies for improving one’s life, covering topics like relationships, career, and mental health.

name: Memoir
description: A form of autobiographical writing, a memoir provides a personal look into the author’s life experiences.

name: Cookbooks/Food & Wine
description: Features recipes and culinary techniques, often themed around types of food, cuisine, or the experiences of a chef.

name: Graphic Novels/Comics
description: Uses sequential art to tell a story, ranging from superheroes to intimate personal narratives.

name: Children’s Books
description: Written for young readers, these books often include illustrations and teach life lessons or tell imaginative stories.

name: Humor
description: Intended to provoke laughter and provide amusement, often through satire, irony, or comedic anecdotes.

name: Travel
description: Covers the experiences of travel, including guides, travelogues, and the exploration of different cultures and places.

name: Religion/Spirituality
description: Explores religious beliefs, spiritual practices, and the quest for meaning.

name: Health/Fitness
description: Provides information on health, wellness, fitness, and diet, often with the goal of improving quality of life.

name: True Crime
description: Explores real criminal cases, delving into the investigation, the criminal mind, and the impact on those involved.

name: Education
description: Covers topics on teaching methods, academic studies, and educational theory, aimed at educators and students alike.

name: Poetry
description: Expresses ideas and emotions through distinctive style and rhythm, including various forms such as sonnets, haikus, and free verse.

name: Art & Photography
description: Showcases visual arts, providing insight into art history, theory, or the work of individual artists and photographers.

name: Business/Finance
description: Offers insights into the business world, discussing economics, entrepreneurship, investment strategies, and personal finance.

name: Politics
description: Discusses the mechanics of politics, policy analysis, governmental structure, and political ideologies.
